page.title: 11LOCAL GEOGRAPHY
page.content: The main feature of the area is the wide, shallow valley of the River Bure which runs in a NW to SE direction. The highest point is about 15m above sea level and the lowest is less than 10m down in the river vally. The river is slow moving and shallow and moves in two great arcs across the area. It has an average width of about 5m. The soil is generally light and sandy though fertile. Near the river it is rather peaty the higher areas are somewhat heavier and flinty. There are deposits of sand and gravel in the south western corner of the area. To the west of the area are the villages of Buxton and Lammas and in the east the aerodrome of R.A.F Coltishall. In between there is extensive farmland.
